content.instruction: In economics, one of the most powerful incentives is money.

hotspots.hotspot: In the product market, firms have an incentive to sell for the highest possible price, while consumers have an incentive to seek the lowest possible price. These competing incentives result in competition among producers, giving consumers more choices and lower prices.

Firms hire workers in the resource market, which is also known as the factor market. Workers have an incentive to earn the highest possible paycheck in order to buy more goods and services to increase their standard of living. But firms have an incentive to pay workers as little as possible, in order to increase profits. These competing incentives lead both workers and firms to increase productivity and efficiency, which reduces overall costs of production.
